result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. SEEHAVER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M. SEEHAVER

records.addlTxt: Entry made in error - cannot be deleted.

The State files an Amended Information which charges one count disorderly conduct-dvo, contrary to Section 947.01(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The Court imposes a $100.00 fine plus costs, total of $579.00, to be paid by 05-17-15 or 12 days county jail for failure to pay.
Counseling information.
Minutes.
Status conference set for 03-17-15 at 4:00 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 01-16-15 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Authorization to Appear; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 12-03-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.
Order denying the petition because the person is not indigent.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 11-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.   
Notice

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of strangulation and suffocation and battery-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no assautlive contact with Kari Zwerg..   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
